text.p: SKOPJE, April 3 - These are the leading stories in the Skopje press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and cannot vouch for their accuracy.
- Construction minister Jorgo Sundovski resigned on Wednesday because of tendentious accusations about his involvement in the TAT financial scandal.

- General manager of TAT Savings society Sonja Nikolovska, now in custody, regularly paid all taxes for savings deposits registered in the computers. However, not one denar was paid for the "secret deposits" registered in parallel books National Bank of Macedonia auditing experts say.
- Sales in Bitola have dropped by 70 percent because of the TAT scandal. The bankruptcy of this savings society severly hurt many Bitola families.
- People from the village of Stenje on lake Prespa spotted a UFO in the form of a mushroom over the last several days. The UFO was first seen between 0610 and 0630 Saturday morning.

- Macedonia national soccer team achieves great victory beating Ireland 3-2. Selector of the team Gojko Hadzievski said: "This a great victory not because of the points but because of the confidence. Romania and Ireland are leaders in this group. We have a difficult match with Iceland on June 7." -- Mircela Casule, Skopje newsroom +389 91 201 196
